name: CUDA-DTW-ED
tagline: Subsequence Search under Euclidean Distance and Dynamic Time Warping
body:
![DTW](https://raw.github.com/gravitino/GPU-Suite/master/images/dtw_alignment.png)
# Algorithms
This supplementary website provides additional material for the parallelization of Subsequence Euclidean Distance (ED) and Subsequence Dynamic Time Warping (DTW) on CUDA-enabled accelerators. The complete source code including the used datasets can be found on the left side at the corresponding github repository.
## z-Normalized Subsequence Euclidean Distance
Our proposed implementation of the locally z-normalized alignment of time series subsequences in a stream of time series data makes excessive use of Fast Fourier Transforms on the GPU. The CUDA-parallelization features log-linear runtime in terms of the stream lengths and is almost independent of the query length. As a result, arbitrarily long queries can be performed without increasing of the runtime in contrast to the ED portion of the [UCR-Suite](http://www.cs.ucr.edu/~eamonn/UCRsuite.html).
![ecg benchmark](https://raw.github.com/gravitino/GPU-Suite/master/images/edecg.png)
![metal benchmark](https://raw.github.com/gravitino/GPU-Suite/master/images/edmetal.png)
The core routines can be found at [our github repository](https://github.com/gravitino/GPU-Suite/blob/master/include/ed.cuh).

## z-Normalized Subsequence Dynamic Time Warping with Sakoe-Shiba Constraint
![DTW diagonal scheme](https://raw.github.com/gravitino/GPU-Suite/master/images/dtwdiagscheme.png)
The proposed parallelization scheme of Constrained Dynamic Time Warping uses wavefront relaxation of the corresponding Sakoe-Shiba band. Furthermore, LB_Kim and LB_Keogh lower bound cascades are provided to prune unpromising matches. Our CUDA version performs one to two orders-of-magnitude faster than the DTW portion of the [UCR-Suite](http://www.cs.ucr.edu/~eamonn/UCRsuite.html) on the tested datasets.

![ecg benchmark](https://raw.github.com/gravitino/GPU-Suite/master/images/dtwecg.png)
![metal benchmark](https://raw.github.com/gravitino/GPU-Suite/master/images/dtwmetal.png)
The core routines can be found at [our github repository](https://github.com/gravitino/GPU-Suite/blob/master/include/cdtw.cuh).
